member.name: T:Hocon.HoconRoot
member.summary: This class represents the root element in a HOCON (Human-Optimized Config Object Notation) configuration string.

member.name: P:Hocon.HoconRoot.Value
member.summary: Retrieves the value associated with this element.

member.name: P:Hocon.HoconRoot.Substitutions
member.summary: Retrieves an enumeration of substitutions associated with this element.

member.name: P:Hocon.HoconRoot.IsEmpty
member.summary: Determines if this root node contains any values

member.name: M:Hocon.HoconRoot.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Hocon.HoconRoot.#ctor(Hocon.HoconValue)
member.param: The value to associate with this element.

member.name: M:Hocon.HoconRoot.#ctor(Hocon.HoconValue,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Hocon.HoconSubstitution})
member.param: The value to associate with this element.
An enumeration of substitutions to associate with this element.

member.name: M:Hocon.HoconRoot.HasPath(System.String)
member.summary: Determine if a HOCON configuration element exists at the specified location
member.param: The location to check for a configuration value.
member.returns: true if a value was found, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Hocon.HoconRoot.HasPath(Hocon.HoconPath)
member.summary: Determine if a HOCON configuration element exists at the specified location
member.param: The location to check for a configuration value.
member.returns: true if a value was found, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Hocon.HoconRoot.Normalize
member.summary: Normalize the values inside all Hocon fields to the simplest value possible under Hocon spec. NOTE: You might not be able to reproduce a clean reproduction of the original configuration file after this normalization.

member.name: M:Hocon.HoconRoot.GetString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a string value from the specified path in the configuration.
member.param: The path that contains the value to retrieve.
The default value to return if the value doesn't exist.
member.returns: The string value defined in the specified path.

member.name: M:Hocon.HoconRoot.GetTimeSpan(System.String,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a value from the specified path in the configuration.

member.name: T:Hocon.HoconArray
member.summary:
This class represents an array element in a HOCON (Human-Optimized Config Object Notation) configuration string.
root { items = [ "1", "2"] }

member.returns: A HOCON string representation of this element.

member.param: The relative path associated with the of the value to retrieve.

P:Hocon.HoconSubstitution.Parent
member.summary: The Hocon node that owned this substitution node

member.summary: The full path to the value which should substitute this instance.

member.name: P:Hocon.HoconSubstitution.ResolvedValue
member.summary: The evaluated value from the Path property

members.member:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
The parent of this substitution. The that this substitution is pointing to. Marks wether this substitution uses the ${? notation or not. /// The of this substitution, used for exception generation purposes.

member.name: M:Hocon.HoconSubstitution.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string representation of this element.
member.returns: The value of this element.

member.name: T:Hocon.TokenType
member.summary: This enumeration defines the different types of tokens found within a HOCON (Human-Optimized Config Object Notation) configuration string.

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.EndOfFile
member.summary: This token type represents the end of the configuration string.

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.StartOfObject
member.summary: This token type represents the beginning of an object, { .

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.EndOfObject
member.summary: This token type represents the end of an object, } .

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.StartOfArray
member.summary: This token type represents the beginning of an array, [ .

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.EndOfArray
member.summary: This token type represents the end of an array, ] .

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.ParenthesisStart
member.summary: This token type represents the opening parenthesis, ( .

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.ParenthesisEnd
member.summary: This token type represents the closing parenthesis, ) .

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.Comment
member.summary: This token type represents a comment.

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.LiteralValue
member.summary: This token type represents the value portion of a key-value pair.

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.PlusEqualAssign
member.summary: This token type represents the assignment operator, +=.

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.Assign
member.summary: This token type represents the assignment operator, = or : .

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.Comma
member.summary: This token type represents the separator in an array, , .

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.SubstituteRequired
member.summary: This token type represents the start of a replacement variable, ${ .

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.SubstituteOptional
member.summary: This token type represents the start of a replacement variable with question mark, ${? .

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.EndOfLine
member.summary: This token type represents a newline character, \n .

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.Include
member.summary: This token type represents the include directive.

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.Required
member.summary: This token type represents the required() directive.

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.Url
member.summary: This token type represents the url() directive.

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.File
member.summary: This token type represents the file() directive.

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.Classpath
member.summary: This token type represents the classpath() directive.

member.name: F:Hocon.TokenType.Error
member.summary: This token type represents a tokenizer error.

member.name: T:Hocon.Token
member.summary: This class represents a token within a HOCON (Human-Optimized Config Object Notation) configuration string.

member.name: P:Hocon.Token.Value
member.summary: The value associated with this token. If this token is a , then this property holds the string literal.

member.name: P:Hocon.Token.Type
member.summary: The type that represents this token.

member.name: M:Hocon.Token.Substitution(System.String,Hocon.IHoconLineInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a substitution token with a given .
member.param: The path to associate with this token.
The of this , used for exception generation purposes.
Designate whether the substitution was declared as `${?`.
member.returns: A substitution token with the given path.

member.name: M:Hocon.Token.LiteralValue(System.String,Hocon.TokenLiteralType,Hocon.IHoconLineInfo)
member.summary: Creates a string literal token with a given .
member.param: The value to associate with this token.
The of this .
The of this , used for exception generation purposes.
member.returns: A string literal token with the given value.

member.name: T:Hocon.Tokenizer
member.summary: This class contains methods used to tokenize a string.

member.name: M:Hocon.Tokenizer.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The string that contains the text to tokenize.

member.name: P:Hocon.Tokenizer.EoF
member.summary: A value indicating whether the tokenizer has reached the end of the string.

member.name: M:Hocon.Tokenizer.Matches(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the given pattern matches the value at the current position of the tokenizer.
member.param: The string that contains the characters to match.
member.returns: true if the pattern matches, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Hocon.Tokenizer.Matches(System.String[])
member.summary: Determines whether any of the given patterns match the value at the current position of the tokenizer.
member.param: The string array that contains the characters to match.
member.returns: true if any one of the patterns match, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Hocon.Tokenizer.Take
member.summary: Retrieves the next character in the tokenizer.
member.returns: The character at the tokenizer's current position.

member.name: M:Hocon.Tokenizer.Take(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a string of the given length from the current position of the tokenizer.
member.param: The length of the string to return.
member.returns: The string of the given length. If the length exceeds where the current index is located, then null is returned.

member.name: P:Hocon.Tokenizer.Peek
member.summary: Retrieves the next character in the tokenizer without advancing its position.
member.returns: The character at the tokenizer's current position.

member.name: T:Hocon.HoconTokenizer
member.summary: This class contains methods used to tokenize HOCON (Human-Optimized Config Object Notation) configuration strings.

member.name: M:Hocon.HoconTokenizer.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The string that contains the text to tokenize.

member.name: M:Hocon.HoconTokenizer.PullPlusEqualAssignment(Hocon.HoconTokenizerResult)
member.summary: Retrieves a token from the tokenizer's current position.
member.returns: A token from the tokenizer's current position.

member.name: M:Hocon.HoconTokenizer.PullComment(Hocon.HoconTokenizerResult)
member.summary: Retrieves a token from the tokenizer's current position.
member.returns: A token from the tokenizer's last position, discarding the comment.

member.name: M:Hocon.HoconTokenizer.PullSubstitution(Hocon.HoconTokenizerResult)
member.summary: Retrieves a token from the tokenizer's current position.
member.returns: A token from the tokenizer's current position.

member.name: M:Hocon.HoconTokenizer.PullQuotedText(Hocon.HoconTokenizerResult)
member.summary: Retrieves a quoted token from the tokenizer's current position.
member.returns: A token from the tokenizer's current position.

member.name: M:Hocon.HoconTokenizer.PullTripleQuotedText(Hocon.HoconTokenizerResult)
member.summary: Retrieves a triple quoted token from the tokenizer's current position.
member.returns: A token from the tokenizer's current position.

member.name: M:Hocon.HoconTokenizer.DiscardRestOfLine
member.summary: Retrieves the current line from where the current token is located in the string.
member.returns: The current line from where the current token is located.

member.name: T:Hocon.Parser
member.summary: This class contains methods used to parse HOCON (Human-Optimized Config Object Notation) configuration strings.

member.name: M:Hocon.Parser.Parse(System.String,Hocon.HoconIncludeCallbackAsync)
member.summary: Parses the supplied HOCON configuration string into a root element.
member.param: The string that contains a HOCON configuration string.
Callback used to resolve includes
member.returns: The root element created from the supplied HOCON configuration string.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when an unresolved substitution is encountered. It also occurs when any error is encountered while tokenizing or parsing the configuration string.

member.name: M:Hocon.Parser.ParseValue(Hocon.IHoconElement)
member.summary: Retrieves the next value token from the tokenizer and appends it to the supplied element .
member.param: The element to append the next token.
member.exception: End of file reached while trying to read a value

member.name: M:Hocon.Parser.ParseArray(Hocon.IHoconElement)
member.summary: Retrieves the next array token from the tokenizer.
member.returns: An array of elements retrieved from the token.
